question: Which island houses "Trou de Fer" canyon?
explanation: Trou de Fer, also known as Iron Hole is a canyon located in the Reunion Island, an overseas region of France, off the coast of Madagascar in the Indian Ocean. The primary river flowing through the gorge is the Bras de Caverne River, a tributary of the Riviere du Mat. It is one of the most magnificent canyons in the world. This canyon is adorned with countless waterfalls, including the 725 meters tall falls ofÂ  Bras de Caverne stream.
